Responsibilities: Initiates or reports incidents and service requests; provides information for problems and approvals for changes where required.
First point of contact for users; logs, categorizes, prioritizes, and resolves incidents or requests where possible; escalates unresolved issues.
Provides advanced troubleshooting and resolution for incidents; supports L1 analysts; assists in root cause analysis.
Handles complex issues and underlying problems; implements permanent fixes; supports change implementation.
Oversees the problem management process; ensures root cause analysis and creation of known error records; coordinates with technical teams.
Reviews, approves, and schedules changes; ensures risk and impact assessments are performed; leads change advisory board meetings.
Accountable for SLA compliance, service performance, reporting, and customer satisfaction; manages escalations and service reviews.
Maintains accuracy of the CMDB; manages configuration item relationships and dependencies; supports change and incident processes.
Creates, reviews, and publishes knowledge articles; ensures lessons learned are documented and shared; improves knowledge reuse.
Ensures security and compliance requirements are met; reviews incidents and changes for security risks; provides guidance on remediation.
Provides external technical assistance for supported systems or services; assists with escalations and patching.
Oversees daily operations; manages workload, ticket queues, and escalations; ensures analysts follow procedures.
Manages helpdesk operations and reporting for their own tenant or organization; limited to scoped visibility and approvals.
Maintains system configuration, integrations, and user access; ensures uptime and performance of the helpdesk platform.
Accountable for the overall delivery and performance of a specific service; ensures documentation, SLAs, and support readiness.
